item.title: Dynamic Grails Tomcat datasource configuration with Etcd
item.description: Ever wonder if you could modify a Grails datasource while the app is running? Probably not, and that’s totally fine…most people don’t need to. We had a couple reasons though: During a disaster recovery situation where a non-clustered database goes down, you want to point all the apps at a failover database. By default this means you have to update the config and restart all the apps. On a typical AWS instance, this means at least a minute of downtime for a bigger Grails app.
